comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9904E2D7133FE633A... MAN IS SHOT DEAD IN CHASE FOR STEER; Frenzied Animal Tears Down Fifth Avenue, Police Shooting from Taxicabs. SEVEN OTHERS SCATTER Wild Bullet Slays a Watchman ;- Waiter Is Wounded ;- All the Beeves Caught or Killed. November 4, 1913, Tuesday A policeman's wild bullet killed a watchman early yesterday morning in a wild cattle chase, which spread consternation in the heart of the city. One lumbering steer seeking to escape pursuit turned into Fifth Avenue at Fifty-ninth Street and, dodging bullets which were fired at it by pursuing policemen, caused such uproar that Fifth Avenue thought that either a gangsters' battle was in progress or a Wild West show had lost its bearings.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for the link, TVL 1970.  We'll add the date from the article to the record the next time we update it.
